subject: Volleyball
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Penn State played near-perfect volleyball in its N.C.A.A. run, winning its second national title while dropping only two games in six tournament matches. The scrappy Nittany Lions even found a way to stun top-seeded Stanford Saturday night in Sacramento, getting 26 kills from Megan Hodge and 19 from Nicole Fawcett against the same university they beat for their first title in 1999.Fawcett served on match point and Penn State capped its 26th straight victory on another powerful kill by Hodge, the tournament’s most valuable player, winning by 30-25, 30-26, 23-30, 19-30, 15-8 exactly three months to the day after losing a five-game thriller to the Cardinal — the last defeat for the Nittany Lions.
